reviews.reviewTitle: Crystal clear sound and convenient digital radio
reviews.reviewText: For many years my wife and I had a regular AM/FM radio in our kitchen that we listened to a lot. It always had some buzzing and crackling. When I changed out our overhead lighting it got even worse so I set out to find a solution. The Mondo+ solved our problem. I found it fairly easy to set up and find my radio stations that I wanted. I thought that I might have to go through an app (you can go this route), but that wasn't the case. I can search and save radio stations straight from the Mondo+ search software. If you register the Mondo+ on your computer you can also save stations and podcasts via your computer so I tried it. Afterwards I went to my Mondo+ and they were magically there. I couldn't be happier. We now have nice clear sounding radio.

reviews.reviewTitle: I found this radio during my research and it appeared to be the best radio for what I wanted to do with it
reviews.reviewText: I did a lot of research when I was looking for a radio or Bluetooth speaker for my new garage. I found this radio during my research and it appeared to be the best radio for what I wanted to do with it. I was especially interested in the SiriusXM capabilities via WiFi and Bluetooth. Upon receiving it I set it up and hooked it up to my WiFi and my Sirius account and it works as advertised. I love it and it has far exceeded my expectations. I also found that I like the internet radio and I heart radio capabilities it has. As far as the sound it sounds great and more than fills up my 30-32 foot garage. I would highly recommend this radio.

reviews.reviewTitle: Does it all without a subscription
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely awesome! This device does it all and you dont even need to purchase a subscription to get your favorite stations! Who needs satellite radio? Stream your own from your iphone or scan the thousands of selections available for free. Forget about AM/FM it doesn't have it and you don't need it with this thing. Only drawback is if you want to position it somewhere without a/c power you will need to buy the optional lithium rechargeable battery pack but that is a minor inconvenience. Five stars plus!

The product is an addition to our Grace Digital unit which we still use. We use both. I like the bluetooth feature that allows streaming from a phone or tablet. The remote can be used or you can control it with an app. I only wish both units were controlled from the same web site. The streams are from different sources which do not give you sinked radio if you listen to the same station in two rooms. I definitely like the newer Mondo + model.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great when it worked ... then it didn't.
reviews.reviewText: Bought this 08/17/2018 for my office. It is now 09/07/2018. The radio at my home (same) works perfectly. This one started getting glitchy; freezing for a few seconds, then a few minutes, then this morning it glitched it's last. Nothing I did could bring it back. Tried several open wi-fi networks ... logged into my own three times. Then I unplugged it for a few minutes and lugged it back in. That was the death of it. The date on the home screen reads 12/31/1999. Wi-fi shows connected but there is no internal activity. Oh well. As I mentioned, the radio at my home works well. Maybe I just got a lemon.

It's not very good looking, but not really ugly. I really wanted something more than over the air radio since I hate trying to stream from my phone or computer to a bed side radio. This unit works fine, but to find the stations you want can really tax your patience. And you can get to only a limited range of stations, so unlike on your computer or phone. And as some other viewers have said, you can't use services such as Tunein to locate them either. The sound is pretty good. The price is higher than its worth but not terribly so. I just wish there were better alternatives.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great as an alarm clock. Customer service not be found.
reviews.reviewText:
I really like the ability to dim the display to various levels. Great when it's by your bedside. Wish the sound quality was better. Also wish I could easily add my Slacker account directly onto the radio. I guess I could broadcast it from my iPhone, but I like to turn my iPhone off at night, so this means I can't fall asleep to music from Slacker.

The instructions weren't the best, but I eventually figured everything out. When I tried to call for tech assistance, I got a recording telling me that all operators were busy and to try and call back later. I tried several times, to no avail. I wouldn't count on customer service. I was not calling during Black Friday or Cyber Monday, so no idea why they should be so busy.

Bought one of these for our master bath a year ago and just got another for the kitchen. I'm a bit of an audiophile and these sound great. The new model uses casting so you start the apps on your phone and "move it" to the radio. A little different than the older model works which has the apps built in but once we got used to it are very happy.

The past ten years I have been living in a valley with weak radio reception. The one station I could receive played a good selection of Classic Rock. They changed format and then there were none. I researched the Amazon offerings and this one met most of my requirement. It will receive local Internet Radio, I Heart Radio and Sirius XM but not Pandora. The setup is a little funky in that you have scroll through letters and number to log onto the internet and the subscriptions. But it was not hard. The sound is fabulous! I have 10 presets defined and enjoy a variety of channels.
It is a whole new world from that one static filled station to the robust sound and the variety available now.

reviews.reviewTitle: Audio output line level is too low.
reviews.reviewText: Generally works well and sounds good, although the PC interface is confusing. The location of the volume control knob (on top) is annoying, especially if the unit is placed on a high shelf. The audio line output level is way too low for compatibility with conventional stereo systems. I had to add an outboard line amplifier to fix this last problem. The radio died once, but came back to life after cutting and restoring power.

I have had the Crane Cc Wi-Fi radio for several years, but recently they stopped streaming my favorite stations due to Clear channel stations license running out. I purchased this radio as I found I can stream my stations thru I heart, which this radio has. I just got it set up and also find that the quality of the audio sound exceeds my expectations. Glad I made the switch.

I have had this radio for about six weeks now and enjoy it regularly. I also bought the battery because I wanted to listen to it while working in the garden and around the pool.
The good:
1) Sound is excellent for a small radio. While it is unlikely to please a true audiophile, I find it to be very good. I added a pair of external speakers that improves the quality even more.
2) WiFi range is very good. I can take it anywhere inside the house and about 100 foot radius outside. Past that range it gets spotty.
3) I can find a radio station by locality, genre or name. Once I find a station I like, I can add it to my favorite stations on the Grace Digital website. I don't know if there's a limit to the number of stations that can be added, but I have added several with no issue.
4) I can listen to mp3 or ogg files using the USB connection. I think it recognizes other formats, but those are the only ones I have confirmed. I am using a powered 4-port USB hub to connect more than one USB device. It recognizes both the portable USB drive and thumb drive that I have connected and I can choose from either to listen.

The bad:
1) The only complaint I have about this radio is the handle. It is only an open area at the top of the radio and is not balanced at all. My hands are large enough to fit around the entire radio, but someone with smaller hands might have difficulty carrying it.

Conclusion: If you are looking for an internet radio, buy this one. You won't be disappointed.

I have been using this radio with both a wired cat6 connection and WiFi and both work very well. The feature that I appreciate most is the ability to go back to specific shows that I missed that day. My only comment is that if this radio is used on a nightstand next to the bed, the screen is pitched backward and it makes the black selector bar on the screen is very hard to read while laying in bed. I was able to resolve this by building a tray for the radio which corrects the screen pitch angle to vertical and the screen selector bar is now readable.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as advertized, but one little complaint
reviews.reviewText:
This is a handy little device to pick up radio stations through wifi, and can pick up stations from all over the country. My wife likes to listen to particular radio programs at particular times, and I was able to find stations that carry those programs exactly when she wants. Some of the stations are over 1000 miles away and come in perfectly through the magic of the internet!

Programming stations is not too hard because you can use the knob to select radio station call letters.

My only complaint is that sometimes it doesn't work and I have to turn it off and on to make it work again.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as expected with pretty good sound
reviews.reviewText: I bought this Mondo to replace a previous one that I bought a few years ago. The old radio's volume control became very erratic making it impossible to set the volume to a desired level. Works as expected with pretty good sound. I use it almost exclusively by feeding the line level audio to an FM transmitter allowing me to broadcast the programs to any room in the house having an FM radio, and to a headset radio when I'm on the lawn tractor. Sometimes there are buffering issues but I've never been able to conclusively cite the Mondo as the problem because my son sometimes stresses the network playing video games. Also, the performance of my internet service is sometimes in question. So overall I'm pleased with the unit.

reviews.reviewDate: The manufacturer commented on the review below
reviews.reviewText: First one that I purchased worked for a month or so, then would not connect to wifi or receive chromecast. Replacement didn't work at all. This, after my last Grace product stopped working after about three years. No more Grace products for me. Three strikes, as they say.

reviews.reviewTitle: Google cast completely stopped working after 6 months
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed this radio for about 6 months. The programmable buttons let us play our favorite stations easily and the Google Cast feature allowed it to integrate with my other google speakers. I could cast to just this radio or to the speaker groups that this belonged too, which was awesome. But after about 6 months, the cast feature completed stopped working. I factory reset it a couple times and began engaging with support (following their steps) but there has been no response for 3 weeks now and the radio still cannot be cast too. All other devices in my home still cast fine. The casting was the main reason we bought this so it is basically now just a "dumb" radio for us now, and not nearly what we want. I'll keep trying, but this has been very unfortunate.

reviews.reviewTitle: Sleep Timer adjustable - Battery not included - Extended coverage
reviews.reviewText:
Grace Digital Mondo+ is a great internet radio! My wife and I listen to talk shows on the Mondo+ at night. The radio has a very good sound and was easy to set up. One of my concerns was the sleep timer. We turn on the radio at night in the sleep setting, but, most radio's I looked into had a 10 minute, or a timer button you need to keep pressing to increase times by 10 minute increments. Since we leave the radio run for 2 to 4 hours the 10/15min would not work well for us. I took a chance on the Mondo+ and was very happy to find that I could set the timer to start where ever I wanted. I set the start of the sleep mode for 2 hours (could modify later if I wish) and if I want more sleep time every press of the button add's another 10 minutes. I would have liked if this 10 minute increments could be adjustable too, but so far I have not found that as an option. There are a lot of stations and going through them takes time. The way the radio stations are found requires a lot of menu work. I would have preferred just turning the tuning knob to get the next station. Maybe there is a way to do that but I haven't found it yet. In the future I will explore the options and take a better look at programming from the web site for the Mondo+. The only thing that I find frustrating, is the battery needs to be bought separately and is expensive. To me a battery case should be provided with the basic radio that can use standard batteries. If a rechargeable battery is preferred, that could be purchased separately. The purchase of the radio was easy and the Amazon Prime worked great getting the radio to me on time. The added insurance I purchased separately to add a few years of repair coverage is confusing. I never received any type of document saying I am covered for an extended time **** (see UPDATE at end of review). I didn't use tech support so I could not put a grade on them. Over all, I highly recommend the Grace Digital Mondo+ for a great internet radio.
**** UPDATE: The added insurance I purchased, DID arrive in my email on time. I overlooked it by accident! I was expecting something in snail-mail but the information WAS in my email.

reviews.reviewTitle: Hooked it up, selected the stations I wanted and never looked back
reviews.reviewText: This replaced a LogiTech wifi radio that I had for many years. I always had problems with the LogiTech as it would lose the signal from my router or mesh network and it would be a big pain to get it back online. This Grace Mondo has been in use for a couple of weeks now without a single disconnect or other problem. It just works like an FM radio would (if an FM radio could get stations from around the world). I haven't tried to cast to it or any other connection, just wifi and I am happy as can be.

reviews.reviewTitle: Awesome little radio. Great sound. Buy Grace Digital's battery.
reviews.reviewText:
We love this little radio. The sound it produces is such quality that you would think you have a bigger system.

FYI - Do not buy the battery that is "usually purchased" with this item. The battery burnt up twice for me. Grace Digital had a battery and they sent me one and it fits great and does not burn up.

I am giving 4 starts only due to that you can't install Pandora on the radio. You can Chrome Cast Pandora all day while using the battery though.

I upgraded from a early Reciva model. They are played thru my own amp and speakers, so no review on sound quality. I like the screen and other features. I just have trouble with searching for stations, and especially for Sirius channels. The thing hangs up and sits there. I don't see the hour glass; its not searching. Its not doing anything. I often have to pull the power cord (power button is also frozen) and start over. Very frustrating. I expected more.

Too bad it doesn't work more often. Just found I've only had it 4 months. About 2 months ago, it wouldn't connect to the internet, but after being unplugged for a day, it worked again - until 4 days ago. Tried 'factory reset' as last resort, now it says it's connected, but does nothing. No radio. No time. Gives the date as Jan 3, 2000. Customer service acknowledged my email 3 days ago, but that's it, so far. NOT a happy purchaser!!

reviews.reviewTitle: This is the best evolution of their product
reviews.reviewText: Been using Grace WiFi radio's for many years. This is the best evolution of their product. Connects to stations across the world and many other services. Easy logical format to use. Has the quirps of all WiFi radios. If you want a good package that has good sound and intuitive tuning this will work for you. Can store an infinite number of stations through the Grace WWW location and all your grace products can use your list of stations.Listen to the world via this grace radio. Sleep timer, alarm, and many usable functions.

This was purchased as a gift for me, but the entire family loves it. Small, portable and easy to use. Love having the convience of a remote. Also like not having to turn on the T.V. to listen to music anymore. Sound quality is great.

It's a nice little radio, very easy to set up and use.

There was one problem, a defective remote control. It took a while to get a replacement, mainly due to the post office messing up my deliveries. Finally got a new one, and it works like a charm. I edited my review to reflect this.

I'm happy with this product

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great. Hooked it up to send audio to my ...
reviews.reviewText: Works great. Hooked it up to send audio to my stereo receiver and output to my B&W speakers. Sounds great. Best of all no more interference when listening to radio! Nice features and build quality. I little pricey but worth it for the features and ease of use.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good sound, useful if you already have stations in mind.
reviews.reviewText:
I like listening to music on this device. It sounds good and plays one of my favorite internet stations (Album 88 Atlanta).

However, discovery of good stations to listen to is lacking. There's a lot of navigational dead ends. Only 10 presets. There are "favorites" folders, but apparently no way to use them from the device itself, or even the smartphone app. Entering letters for search is tedious.

Overall, I don't regret buying this, but if the interface was easier to use, I'd be a lot happier.

reviews.reviewTitle: A nicely designed and fully functional internet radio
reviews.reviewText:
After my Logitech Squeezebox went belly up I looked for something to replace it. After doing some research the Digital Mondo+ looked like a good replacement. It is! There are more stations available than I imagined. I liked the way the stations were organized. I found a few local stations right away and added them right away. It is easy to set and change alarms. The sound is pretty good for a small device. The sleep timer feature comes in handy. The remote control is a bonus. It would be even better if the keypad had some kind of backlight to be able to use in a dark room.
I don't like the way the screen brightens when a change is made to the volume, station selection etc.. This is really distracting in a darkened room. It also takes a while to get use to using the push buttons when selecting a saved station. The station may take a while to play because of buffering. If you hold down the button too long you've saved the station as a preset.
This is the second unit that I have purchased. Very pleased with these radios.

Needed something to play lullabies and classical music for our baby, and got really tired of cheesy repetitive music and light projection systems pushed out to parents these days. Did a good bit of research and decided on the Mondo+ and it was everything I hoped it would be, wanted and needed; tons of free internet radio genres and channels to chose from, iheart radio stations, plus the pay music services all in a very easy to set up and use device.

The sound clarity is really good, and gets plenty loud. It even has a sleep function if you don't want it on all night. The display can dim down quite bit, which is great for us to not disturb our little one with unwanted light. All in all I'm very pleased with it and pleasantly surprised. Haven't had any connection issues what so ever. Wish the buttons could have backlight, but it's definitely not a deal breaker. Great internet radio!

I can wake up to any internet radio station, buzzers, birds, waves, whatever. It has a sleep timer that can be set to any duration which can also play any internet radio, I heart radio, bbc, npr, podcast, even a wide selection of 'white noise and nature sounds. This little radio can sync to the larger Encore + system, or another of the same Mondo +, in another room so that the radio's play on the same beat; if one is hooked up to ethernet cable and the other on wi-fi, they do not play in sync and the wi-fi radio will be a few beats, or half a sentence behind. Both must be wi-fi for them to sync. The sound is ok. It has an equalizer so podcasts can have more vocal ranges. Was going to buy the Bose internet radio, but I am VERY happy with both of my Grace Digital products.

So much so that I bought four of them. I would have purchased five, but they wouldn't let me! I have one in my bedroom, one in my office, one in my kitchen and one in my living room. I would have put the fifth in the bath.

The sound quality is excellent. Plus, obviously, since it's internet, you can listen to stations all over the world. So much to explore!

This is such a great product. Treat yourself. You won't regret it!

I love this radio. Picks up local stations using their internet streams so the sound is always clear. You can also set up iHeartRadio, Sirius XM or other accounts and play them on here too. It also acts as a Chromecast device so you can cast audio from apps on your phone or other device to the radio. It’s great!

reviews.reviewTitle: Overall this a very good Streaming radio
reviews.reviewText: Overall this a very good Streaming radio. Has not dropped out once yet from buffering problems. Just keeps playing from my Wireless Internet connection. I have only used the built in stations so far and very happy with the selection to choose from. Setting up your internet connection will take a few minutes to enter the password but it scans to find the available networks. No issues with staying connected on a network or WiFi range. The more you play around with it, the more features you will find. It even has some Live ATC feeds saved by location in the USA. No hesitation in recommending this product. I am using this to feed a Low Power FM broadcast station at my rural property. That way I can listen to the stream on any FM radio. Cheers VE3 OPD
Perfect if you are looking for the best internet radio do not think twice also great support =)

reviews.reviewText: worked great for about 3 weeks, then came two firmware updates and that's when it stopped working great. I have an older Grace radio that works well, wanted to upgrade to a newer model with more features, I'll continue to use my old radio until it is completely obsolete. If it would work like it is supposed to it would be a five star rating.

This is a fantastic internet radio. The sound coming from a speaker this size is phenomenal. Admittedly, it's not the same as a large home theater system, but if you have this in your bedroom, you will be pleased with the sound. It can play quite loud, too, so you can easily hear it in the bathroom if your radio is in the bedroom (I don't recommend playing it a full volume with bass heavy tracks, though, because I do get some distortion). Some other reviewers commented on the sound being "flat." Well, it IS by default, but that is a quality of a good speaker. I find that vocals sound very live and accurate. Acoustic music is fantastic. I have made some adjustments in the equalizer settings which have tailored the sound to my preference (try setting Treble at 5 and Bass at 3). I really like the interface overall, and having an iPhone app to control it is really handy. I can start the radio playing from anywhere in the house. You can also access most of the functions of the radio through the app, including setting the alarm clock.

I like that there are so many options for listening to music on the device. You can stream from pretty much any internet music service (SiriusXM is my favorite, but there are tons of free services, too). You can save music to a USB thumb drive and play from there (look at the SanDisk Cruzer Fit if you want a drive that won't stick out very far on the back of the radio). I have also been able to stream my entire iTunes music collection from my Mac by installing the Twonky Media Server on the Mac and using the UPnP interface on the radio.

One of the main reasons that I bought this particular radio was the ability to set multiple alarm clocks with different alarms on different days (you can set up to five). Previously, I used a Sony Dash, and Sony decided not only to stop supporting the service, but to kill the device entirely. With the Mondo+, you can wake up to an obnoxious buzzer sound (great for heavy sleepers) or any of your presets. Super tip: Download some nice alarm sounds to a USB thumb drive, set one of those sounds as a preset, and choose that preset for your alarm. Then, you can wake up to any sound you like. Of course, you can wake to internet steaming or anything else you can make a preset.

Now a couple negatives. The iPhone app locks up and crashes sometimes, but it is improving. The radio interface still has some bugs in it, and acts unpredictably at times. I will say that in the short time I've had the radio, the company has already issued two firmware updates which have squashed some of the initial bugs I was experiencing. They seem very committed to releasing very regular (every couple weeks) firmware updates, too. This is a new product, so you would expect a few minor issues.

Finally, the customer support from the company is nothing short of amazing. I e-mailed them with some concerns and suggested improvements, and they e-mailed back very quickly. They even made some of the changes I recommended in their recent firmware updates. They listen and they want their radio to be the best on the market. Any company that is so committed to improvement and customer satisfaction has my business!

In summary, buy this radio! You won't regret it. It's a fantastic device that is improving with time.

Through the years I owned and enjoyed 3 Mondos, and I like them. But, now that I have the Mondo+, something is not right. The Mondo had 3 Display Brightness Setting: "Active", "Inactive" and "Standby" modes as does the new Mondo Plus. Unfortunately, however, unlike the old Mondo, in which one can set the brightness level, for example: Standby=0, "Active" and/or "Inactive" set to any number above "0" (depending on one's choice of brightness) and when it comes to go to bed, the "Standby"=0 setting would work wonders in conjunction with the "Sleep" timer if one may have some hard time falling asleep with brightness. The result is one would fall asleep listening to news, talk show, music or what have you in COMPLETE darkness. Then when the timer is up, the "Inactive" setting takes over the "Standby" mode; and the CLOCK on the radio is clearly visible as it should. The weird thing is that while the Mondo+ has those same 3 settings, the "Standby" setting OVERRIDES any of the other settings whether the radio is "ON" or "OFF" after the Sleep Timer is timed "OFF". Yes, the radio would be always DARK regardless what the "Active" and "Inactive" settings may have been set to!. Of course, one can manually rotate the selector wheel and get the desired brightness level, but not the programmable auto settings as the old Mondo used to do. That was very frustrating and Greg and company know about this issue. Not sure if they are going to correct them through their coming software update?
Another odd thing I noticed in their latest database is the (BBC, CBS, NPR and Public Radio) channels are now placed on the "MUSIC Player" folder as opposed to the "Internet" folder, with sub folders of "News", "News talk"! For the life of me, I couldn't understand why "BBC World News", for example, be placed on a "Music Player" folder! They are 24/7 News and Newstalk only. No I did not get a lemon radio. This is a replacement radio that is acting the same as the one I returned.
Think about it, why would Grace Digital engineers provide the 3 settings, if the "Standby" setting is going to override the "Active" & "Inactive" settings?
Lastly, I am hoping that I have a lemon radio as far as the following issue goes:
1) Strangely my Radio froze and I could not turn off the radio using the shutoff button or anything else. The only way to turn off was to do a hard stop by unplugging the power cord.
2) While I was so happy with the speed in which the radio was able to connect to my WiFi network, this couple of days it is taking longer to seek, find and connect with the WiFi, while my other electronic stuff didn't have any problems.
But, again my biggest gripe remains with the display brightness settings.
UPDATE!
The Screen Display Setting WILL NOT CHANGE even manually once the radio is "ON". The manual change of the setting is possible ONLY when the sleep timer is activated.
I think with some people expressing desire for AUTO dimming, Grace would to a favor to its customers by providing that option.

reviews.reviewTitle: This Clock/Radio is Not As Advertised!
reviews.reviewText:
I owned a previous radio from Grace and was incredibly happy with it. The Mondo isn't as advertised and users will be severely disappointed in the model and firmware at this time.

Pros: The sound quality is terrific for a small clock-radio. It's compact and the design is attractive. The build appears to be reasonably solid.

Cons: The software features are severely limited. They advertise Pandora, Amazon streaming, etc. This is only if you use Chromecast. I still don't understand all the technical details of what this means, but as an iPhone guy, it essentially means that you have to manually choose on your iPhone what station you want to listen to after linking your phone to the radio via Bluetooth and selecting your device on the radio. Three or four steps to listen to Pandora. Now for the "awesome" news... forget using Amazon Music or Pandora as your alarm clock. You aren't allowed to set up any of these stations as your presets, so no Pandora or Amazon Music in the morning.

The other serious con to this radio is Grace Digital's customer support. They are only open until 4:30 Pacific time Monday-Thursday and until Noon on Friday. Unfortunately the product manual is poorly designed and is not designed as a step-by-step how-to for various features, and the website is buggy with a lot of old information for even older products.

I live in Canada and have two other Grace Digital radios, as well as a Squeezbox. I am perfectly happy with them but the Mondo+ turned out to be the biggest mistake imaginable. Let me explain. I opened a new account for the Mondo+, registered the radio and started looking in the website for my favorite stations to add. Finding stations is ridiculously difficult. In many cases neither the radio nor the website find the station at all and I know the station exists because I have it saved in my other radio account. Then, when I found some stations and saved them in the Favorites "Saved stations" directory, I couldn't access them on the radio because no matter how many times I restarted the radio, the "Saved stations" folder remained empty. Maybe I have to wait for 24 hours or something. Then, when I tried to play the stations from the general directory, most of them wouldn't play at all and the Mondo+ would display the same message again and again: "Internet streamer error". I want to point out that all those stations play perfectly well on the other two Grace radios (older versions) as well as on my computer, so there is nothing wrong with the streaming of the station itself. Then, when I found the stations in TuneIn and tried to send them to the radio via Chromecast, the Mondo+ blurted the following message:"This radio stream is incompatible with Chromecast. Please, contact the radio station to request a compatible stream." Are you kidding me??? And this is supposed to be a radio that leads the way?? Then I tried the iHeart Radio app. I was greeted by the message : "This service is not available outside the United States". You are not even allowed to browse the stations, let alone listen to them. I know many iHeart radio stations are geo-restricted to the US only but not all of them. Why can't I try my luck at least with some of them? The other service, CBS Radio (Radio.com) - same story. I am not allowed to listen to them from Canada. Another thing that annoyed me about the Mondo+ is that you do not have the option to choose your home city. In the older version, if I chose Miami, at least I would have all southern Florida radio stations huddled together in the Local stations directory, which I love! With the Mondo+ you can only choose a country, a state (in the US) and then you get several hundred stations and good luck browsing them. In this respect the Logitech Squeezebox is simply perfect! In it the stations are grouped by city even when you browse small countries like Bulgaria. On the Mondo+ website, if you click Reciva search you do not even have the option to look for stations by country, only by genre. And if you click Station search, it finds only 2-3 stations out of available 9 for a country like Cuba.I thought some stations wouldn't play because I might have a problem with the wifi signal strength. Unfortunately on the Mondo+ I could not find the option to check my wifi signal strength. The little icon on the screen showing the wifi strength never changed the bars no matter where I put the radio.I own three Internet radios, two of them Grace Digital. I look at my new purchase in dismay and don't believe my bad luck. The radio will go back where it came from. The boast that it has a database of 30 000 stations is irrelevant to me since it bluntly refuses to play most of the ones I want to listen to because I am in Canada or the streaming is incompatible with I don't know what. When you pay 289 Canadian dollars for a radio, you expect a bit more. In my opinion the Mondo+ is a serious downgrade from its predecessor, Chromecast or not. To me it is a little more than a loudspeaker. With all this said, I admit that I absolutely LOVE my other two Grace radios. I am returning this one and will try to buy another Grace Mondo from the older version. Everything in it works flawlessly.

I'm an experienced user, I've owned several internet radios for more than ten years. Lately many stations have been changing their streams to incompatible formats, but the Mondo+ amazingly has played almost everything I've attempted to play, except BBC MPEG-DASH streams.

If you cannot find a station in the Grace Radios+ database, you can now also access the extensive and well maintained Reciva database and add stations directly from there. The individual saved station stream HTTP addresses are fully displayed in your My Stuff favorite's folder. Each individual station saved is fully configurable including the associated image and HTTP address, really a fantastic favorite's implementation with no equal. To top it off, and contrary to most other current internet radios, the Mondo+ is fully compatible with the new hls live streams, including any m3u8 station URLs that you may want to add manually.

You do not need to be an expert to use this radio, as it comes with an easy to use interface, an exceptional updated printed manual, and a US based wonderful support team.

reviews.reviewTitle: Who says you can't get no satisfaction? With this radio from Grace Digital you get just that. Satisfaction. And more!!
reviews.reviewText:
As the happy and deliriously satisfied owner of three, count 'em, 3(!) Grace Digital Internet radios I am happy to report that the Mondo+ I recently purchased for my older brother is, per his own words, FANTASTIC!!!!

And while my brother has not yet begun to explore all the facets of this fabulous device, he is totally satisfied with it to date! It is portable! It is robust! It's sound is very, very, good!!!! And he is looking forward to discovering even more of its features as well as favorite new stations from around the globe.

He is now a BIG fan of internet radio and one might say an eager owner of Grace Digital's Mondo+. Eager for more music which provides more memories of a wonderful past and new songs to attach to new memories from today. You will not be disappointed with this gem of an internet radio from Grace Digital.

I have personally visited their offices and can say that they are among the most passionate and polite people in business today. With a product like the Mondo + it is easy to see why.

I needed an alarm clock that allows multiple alarms for multiple days and this does the job very well. I can also pick different Radio Tunes stations to load from the presets. The volume is good and the sound is very good, although not HiFi. If I have a problem the staff at Grace is very responsive. They also present updates in the software. You can't go wrong with this clock/radio. I highly recommend it.
It allows 5 different alarm settings so you can set it and forget it, with settings for the weekdays and different ones for the weekends. You can also have 1-time alarm for a special occasion.

I love this Internet radio! In addition to many stations from around the world, what sold the Grace Mondo+ to me is the fact that my Sirius XM radio subscription for my car extends to this radio for a small additional monthly fee. The sound is rich for the relatively small footprint. One suggestion is that if you want to record to an external device (such as a Crane CC Witness Plus, which I use), that you should attenuate the output (I use a Sound Professionals SP-ATEN-1-8-12513) in order to "clean" the heavy bass output. Grace is very willing to support this product. Don't be surprised if you see an update download to the Grace Mondo+ in the middle of the day!

reviews.reviewTitle: A connected internet streaming radio with chromecast and more..
reviews.reviewText:
Chromecast built-in, both 5 and 2.4ghz radios, larger display than Logitech... Sirius XM is built in.. .. Also can be used as a BT connected speaker...

Purchased this via their crowdsourcing campaign vs Amazon...

Pandora seems to refuse to play with hardware vendors nowadays and wants to insist on streaming by phone app lately... Pandora is worse that Spotify about this... Pandora wants to shutter their device based apps and ONLY allow app streaming from a phone or tablet..
Native Spotify is supposedly in the works....
BBC is native

Chromecast however is pretty seamless and is vastly superior than just BT streaming from a phone....

reviews.reviewTitle: Great features and value. Keeps getting better with updates.
reviews.reviewText: It's an excellent internet radio and chromecast enabled smart speaker. The manufacturer has been very responsive to suggestions and has continually been making improvements since I got it. Having the ability to add a battery to it to allow fully wireless use is also very handy for use around the house and yard.
Easy to setup and use, and it sounds great! It also is reliable and retains settings. I listen to WFSO.

I relocated from the Bay Area to the Austin area. I found myself missing my favorite radio stations. Hearing about something called a wireless internet radio, I investigated. I purchased one from another company and was not very happy with it and gave up on the prospect of hearing my favorite stations again.
Then I started hearing about the Grace Digital Mondo+ Radio. It looked promising so thought I would give it a try.
Now this radio gets the job done! Not only can I now listen to the Bay Area radio stations I miss, but the radio just plain looks good. It is very sleek and modern with a display that is large and easy to read. The sound is very good and can be adjusted to your taste. If you like more bass, you can have it. If you prefer more treble, adjust away.
I had no idea what Chromecast was but found out that I can use that to stream music from my iPhone to my Mondo+, and Chromecast in built-into the radio....no additional attachments necessary.
Not being a technical person, I did have to contact Tech Support once. They responded quickly and I was on my way to completing the set-up. Strictly Operator Error on that one.
I did purchase the optional USB to Ethernet connector as that made the connection even stronger. The reception for all stations has been strong.
I find this radio to be well worth the money and it does everything it said it would. I am very glad I decided to take a chance and try internet radio again.
I hope that this helps you to decide.

reviews.reviewTitle: Resetting every time the power goes off is too much for me!!
reviews.reviewText: This is a fine radio but I would never buy another one since every time it loses power, which happens frequently where I live, partly because our power supplier has problems, and partly because our cleaning woman tends to unplug the radio every time she cleans the room it's in, one has to laboriously re-enter a long code message to get the thing to work again. Why all of that information is not simply stored in the unit's memory is beyond me, but, at least unless they have since fixed the problem, it isn't. So I often turn on the radio, see the request for the elaborate "code" to make my own damn radio work again, get a bit annoyed, and turn on my regular, no code requiring, FM radio instead. All in all the various stations it allegedly allows one to listen to, -- and many remain unavailable! -- do not outweigh the cumbersomeness of the design. Clearly internet radio needs to correct such problems if it ever is to catch on!

I love Grace radios, and this is the best yet...easy to use and lots of apps like Iheart radio, Sirus/XM, and live365...and they are constantly updating the software to make it even better. This is great for an old fart like me, who wants to access internet radio, in a way that feels like the radios of old...love it

reviews.reviewTitle: I really Love The Mondo+! The New Mondo+ is fantastic! I love it and will be purchasing more! Holidays are coming! A great gift!
reviews.reviewText:
I love my Mondo +! This radio connects quicker and does more than the original. The Chromacast function is something that opens many other doors or options to stream broadcasts as well as music apps. The display is beautiful and easy on the eyes as well! The engineering on this unit is superb! Another feature is The portability with the battery(sold separately) on Amazon at a very reasonable price by the way! The Mondo + also has Bluetooth which is another way to stream music,radio or podcasts. So many options there's always a way to get what you want! I also like the new software updates and the addition and integration of iTunes on the Mondo+!
Another thing I wanted to mention was that when I go into the local search mode I get many more local stations than on the older model! The key here is you have real access with the Mondo+! Bottom line the Mondo+ is a winner!

I bought this as a replacement for a Grace Mondo I'd had for years n dearly loved. I was expecting access to Pandora and the Receiva data base for station selection. Pandora is inaccessible on this unless you do some work around using a smart phone which I do not have. Grace now uses their own station data base which i find vastly inferior to the selection I had on Receiva. Up to a third of the stations listed turn out to be dead links. I love Classical music, that genre has a pathetic selection, many play movie soundtracks or new Age stuff. I wound up buying a refurbished Mondo which does have Pandora and Receiva access. The Mondo plus works fine and sounds great. It just doesn't have the coverage I wanted and I feel Grace wasn't honest in their descriptions of what it does.

I had originalIy written a mediocre review of the Grace Digital Mondo (not plus), which died after a few years. However, I plugged it in one last time before throwing it out (I'd plugged and unplugged it multiple times prior to this), and it worked. It's been working ever since (more than a week). I now believe that it was not a defect in the radio, but in the cable/wireless system in my house. Hence, I've changed my rating. I have three other Grace Digital Internet radios in the house, older models, and they've been working fine right along (in different rooms). I now recommend the brand without reservation.

What’s easy to set up, sounds great, and delivers all that it promises? You guessed it. I’m talk about my Mondo+ from Grace Digital. This internet radio is a great affordable product. As long as you have internet in your home you’ll be able to listen to hundreds of stations on the internet. Music, talk, news, sports and more. The presets are easy to set up, the sound coming from the speaker is great. I keep my Mondo+ beside my bed and the original Mondo I moved to bathroom so I can catchup on news from around the world when I’m getting ready for work. I don't always listen to internet radio, but when I do it’s on my Mondo+ or my original Mondo. No, I don’t work for Grace Digital. I’m just a happy consumer.

reviews.reviewTitle: Paper weight function is only operational part!
reviews.reviewText: Purchase this product if you need a large paper weight. It weighs in around one or two pounds and can keep a limited amount of paper in place against moderate wind. Based on my product: It is nicely designed black radio that cannot tune into any internet radio station. Don't be mislead by description calling thinking it can play audio from internet radio stations, that part doesn't appear to work, or stops working shortly after being plugged in. Product support is unavailable from manufacturer.

If you are looking for a great wifi radio and alarm clock, look no further. The Mondo+ is THE answer. This updated version of the original Mondo from Grace Digital has great features and great sound.

While the Mondo+ does not have the Pandora choice directly in it as the original Mondo did, anyone can cast Pandora to the Mondo+ from their phone and/or tablet via Chromecast. Chromecast works great with the Mondo+ and has worked flawlessly thus far.

The updated Mondo+ is a great music source via wifi, chromecast, or even your own pc. It is economical for the high-end quality you are receiving. It is certainly a step up from the original Mondo and I give it my highest recomendation for currently available wifi radios!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great sound. Cumbersome as an alarm clock
reviews.reviewText:
Feel like sleeping in and want to turn off the alarm clock for tomorrow morning? No problem.
1. Press ON/OFF
2. Press BACK
3. Turn menu wheel to "ALARMS"
4. Press selector wheel
5. Navigate to the desired alarm (one of 10)
6. Navigate to DISABLE
7. Press the selector wheel.
8. Press ON/OFF

Now, on my other basic alarm clock, I just need to press the Alarm On/Off button and I'm done.

This is the price one has to pay in order to be able to wake up to any radio station, any music from any source. If I want to sleep in, it's easier to just unplug the entire device.

reviews.reviewTitle: A great product, poised to get even better
reviews.reviewText: The Mondo and the Mondo+ are outstanding products. The sound is great, the Sirius XM connection works great, finding local radio stations around the USA is easy, the presets work. They are great products to have. The Mondo+ definitely needs some updates as not all the features are yet operational, and some of the features that are in the Mondo are not yet in the Mondo+. Most bothersome features not available to me are: a) can't get the USB player to play in the Shuffle Mode on the Mondo+ when the feature is available in the Mondo, and b) certain pause, rewind, and forward controls do not work. However, I'm very pleased to have both radios and use them extensively. Love to listen to radio stations from around the country. Virtually all are available. I look forward to having all potential of the Mondo+ realized in the near future. (For sports radio fans, there is a feature that is quite unique and valuable: It's quirky to get to, and I'm not sure how I did it, but I did it once. Say a baseball game, available on SiriusXm starts at 7pm and you want to listen to it beginning at 9pm. There is a way to turn on the radio at 9pm, and play the game from the beginning which started two hours earlier. Absolutely great if you are into such things.) Battery works great too. A must to have as the radio is quite portable. Service folks in California are very helpful too and anxious to please.

got the radio hooked up quickly. Only rarely does it lose the WiFi connection, but it easy to reboot. The radio has a timer so you can set it and fall asleep to the programing. The only issue is that the sound is only OK and really needs a satellite speaker for the other nightstand. Also, illuminated buttons for station selection would be nice to have. Otherwise a great investment.
This radio lights up my life... in fact it was so wonderful that we bought a second one. The Grace customer support also deserve similar rave reviews. Sounds good, looks good, and improves my mood!

If you are thinking about buying this I would highly suggest looking at an echo first. Most models are cheaper, they are much better internet radios. reviews.reviewTitle: Great Internet Radio and much more

There isn't much that the Mondo + is missing. I like the audio quality. It has an equalizer one can adjust but I've stayed with the default...lots of base but clean.

I also like the connectivity options the Mondo + offers. If I want I can "cast" a tab from my desktop chrome browser to the radio. Or I can cast a radio station playing on my Google Home/Google Assistant to the Mondo +. And it can function as a bluetooth speaker!

The Mondo + is the best of the internet radios...and firmware is being upgraded all the time, so it can only get better! I purchased this Mondo+ internet radio for her for Christmas because it had a large display and big preset buttons. She just loves it, I programmed her stations for her and she has no problem using it. A couple of her stations were not available on Grace Digitals site but they added them for me in about 2 days. reviews.reviewTitle: Great internet radio depending on the functions you want.
reviews.reviewText: Others have commented on the features and limitations of this device, so I won't repeat that. Bottom line - the Mondo+ is a great device if you are satisfied with it functions. I wanted an internet radio that is very portable, that could save lots of "favorite" internet stations, and could also stream audio from other devices. This meets all those requirements very well. I have had this product for about 2 years. when it works it works. However, it is really poorly engineered and the software is cr*p. It has a great deal of difficulty connecting to existing wifi. Entering passwords is a pain. Editing them or deleting them is more of a pain and almost never works. You will find yourself continually frustrated. Unplugging, replugging it in. reviews.reviewTitle: Great Product from a Great Company.

reviews.reviewTitle: Thanks to the good people at Grace Digital
reviews.reviewText:
Thanks to the good people at Grace Digital, I received a gray Mondo Plus today. The exterior, as far as I can tell, is identical to the past Mondo. In the box were the familiar Grace remote and an RCA-to-3.5mm jack “Y” cable. I may order the optional battery later if I decide to use this Mondo as a clock radio, as a precaution against oversleeping due to power outages.

I plugged the Mondo Plus into the wall and pressed the “power” button. It sprang to life and asked whether I wanted a wired or a wireless connection and I selected “wireless.” Then it asked whether I wanted to scan for a network or to enter it manually and I did a scan. It found my network and asked for my password. On the first attempt it said “network not found” but it worked on the second try.

The scrolling on the Mondo Plus is a bit odd. After selecting a number or letter, it resets to “A” each time rather than remaining on the selected letter. This might make entering a long password annoying but I was fine with it. Another criticism is that it is hard to see the black scroll bar against the dark blue background screen, but I managed that. Once my Mondo Plus accessed the network it wanted to update its firmware. The update took about 5 minutes. The firmware version the radio loaded is 142.36. The radio then came to life.

The main screen gives the following menu: internet radio, music services, media player, radio settings, aux in and equalization. Under internet radio the menu choices are: search for local stations, history, my stuff (my streams, my podcasts and my stations), search for station by name, search for station by genre and search for station by location. The music services available are Sirius XM, iHeartRadio, NPR and Public Radio, BBC, CBS and Podcasts by Audiosear.ch.

I decided to test the ability to add a station, Jazz24, to my streams using the portal to the radio which is at myradiosplus.gracedigital.com. One just goes to “my streams” clicks on “add new” then pastes the streaming url in a box. The site also asks for the url for station art, which I didn’t know. The stations played on the radio from “my streams” without any problems.

I then decided to cast to the radio from my phone using Chromecast built-in. I went to the Google Home app and the Mondo Plus showed up as a Chromecast device. From my Pocketcasts app I clicked on the Chromecast icon and the Mondo Plus appeared in the “cast to” list. It was then simple to cast the podcast from the Pocketcast app to the radio.

I also used the “media player” function. The radio asked for “UPnP” or “USB.” I selected UPnP
and it found the music stored on my NAS without any delay or fuss.

A couple of minor drawbacks: the Android Grace Controller App available through Google Play Store needs further work. It cannot fully search a list of internet radio stations for each country; it only searches the country that appears first in the alphabet for each continent. That needs to be fixed. Also, I tried adding a podcast to “my podcasts” but it wouldn’t play on the radio. I understand that Grace is fixing this in an upcoming firmware update.

So far, I can say I’m very impressed with Mondo Plus.

After the winter months of not using it very much it no longer would play unless it was plugged into an outlet. reviews.reviewText:
I had high hopes for the Mondo+.

I owned the original Grace Mondo. I bought it as a replacement for my Squeezebox. While it was decent enough, it is still a poor number two to the Logitech. The Mondo lacked the all the apps available on the Squeezebox, as well as much of the versatility and functionality. If you are someone who likes to fall asleep with the headphones plugged in, it will negate the alarm. The Mondo plays the alarm though the headphones - you will sleep right though your wake up time! On the other hand, the SB had a nice feature where if you fall asleep with headphones plugged in (like a lot of people do), the alarm would bypass the headphones and play through the speaker, ensuring that you WILL wake up on time with the Squeezebox.

But not with the Mondo OR the Mondo+. With those two, you'll be late to work.

If you already have a Mondo, it ain't worth upgrading to the Mondo+. If you are hell bent on getting a smart radio, do this and save yourself some money:

- Buy a used original Mondo
- buy one of these: http://a.co/aRA47Rs

Boom... You have a Mondo+ for far less. Or buy a used Squeezebox. Either way, I'd skip over the Mondo+ It's just not worth it. The lack of apps, lack of functionality, lack of versatility, AND the alarm issue is a big sticking point.

Also, Grace Digital customer support is very poor as well.
It is a great radio, but it does not last long. This is the second radio, and Grace is no help.
